entries.meaning: A fine engraved pattern of spirals, intertwining bands, etc.
examples: A railroad right-of-way, straight across the Balkan Peninsula, conceded in Cyrillic and Arabic script all woven in and out of the loveliest green guilloche by the no-longer-quite-unabsorbed entity of East Roumelia.

entries.meaning: The tool used to create such work.

verbs.description: guilloche (third-person singular simple present guilloches, present participle guilloching, simple past and past participle guilloched)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To decorate with intersecting curved lines.
